model.comment: SC8 is a stationary decoder, but it can be programmed in the usual way

enumChoice.choice: Move servos to the other end
Move servos to the other end

variable.tooltip: Only in SC8 version 16 and later
variable.label: Start up delay

label.text: Use this number to set the address number
of the device the output is connected to.
The Custom Programmer format is recommended
Note: Changes to Option CVs are not recognized until SC8 power is cycled.
Opt4 Enable gateway for DCC commands from track to bus
- Requires bus interface and DCC control to be enabled
Opt5 Enable transmit and receive on bus
Opt6 Enable receiving DCC commands from track
- When disabled, DCC gateway is disabled
Note: In a Digitrax system the bus is called LocoNet
This is the same as a Loco address

display.tooltip: Delay start up time 4 to 30 in seconds

label.text: Opt1 Send output state at power on
Opt2 Send output state at Digitrax interrogation request
---- Sets the SC8 to a particular test state - Use to help adjust servos ----
Changes the value of CV7 (Version ID) as displayed in DP
Test State may change when Version ID is read

display.tooltip: Sends opposite switch state from previous send - Switch Request only
Configures the input for specific use
Inverts the normal state of Close when input goes hi

label.text: When a switch (turnout) throw command is issued that matches this address the SC8 inputs are disabled.
When a close command is issued with this address the inputs are enabled.
This feature is useful for dispatcher control when the SC8 inputs are used for local turnout control.
---- Sets the output state to always be the same at power on ----
Note: If a sensor message is selected to execute a route then
switch state c and t is used for sensor hi and lo respectively.
